intro: Solanum aculeolatum, commonly known as the prickly nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, characterized by its spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale purple, followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Its botanical features include opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and a system of tubular roots. Solanum aculeolatum belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
